Description: Lip and wall sherd (mended from four fragments) of North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; interior glazed streaky brown, save at lip, with two added red bands lined in white preserved; exterior, cream slip: hasty tongues at lip, every fourth or fifth red; in frieze below two geese and a sphinx to left, large palmette behind sphinx; red paint on alternate section of wings of geese and of sphinx, on alternate petal of palmette; below, meander running left; between decorative fields, dividing bands with added red band lined in white.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.221)
